creator.name: Raden / Hoven van Politie en van Justitie van Demerary en Essequebo
creator.name_english: Councillors / Councils of Policy and of Justice of Demerara and Essequibo
creator.his_func:
In 1690 there was a Board of two or three officials or planters to advise the Commander in the colony of Essequibo. In 1718 the Zeeland Chamber set up a board to treat all political and judicial affairs. If necessary, this council met. Every year a copy of the minutes had to be sent to the West India Company (WIC).

After the addition of the settlement of Demerara to the main colony of Essequibo (1740), two councils were established: a Council of Policy and a Council of Justice. The first one discussed mainly the political and commercial interests of the WIC and the issue of land. The second one sat in judgment on all inhabitants. Because this judicial council was so distant, Demerara had a Council for Minor Cases.

During the British occupation Essequibo and Demerara experienced no major changes in governance structure.
